quiz_title: Quiz on Azraq PC250 Server Hardware and Deployment

questions.question: Which statement best describes the role of the RDNA‑2 GPU in the PC250 chassis?

options.A: It serves solely as a graphics accelerator for local workstations.
options.B: It provides 24 compute units that allow the server to process general-purpose workloads in addition to graphics.
options.C: It delivers a 24‑compute‑unit, RDNA‑2 architecture that is designed for gaming performance at lower power consumption.
options.D: It operates with 36 compute units, making it identical to the GPU in the PS5 version.

questions.explanation: The PC250’s GPU is an RDNA‑2 device with 24 compute units, specifically selected for efficient gaming graphics within a low‑power server chassis. Option A limits its role, option B overstates CPU‑GRP use, and option D incorrectly states 36 compute units which belong to the PS5. Thus C accurately reflects the hardware’s intended use.

questions.question: How many logical threads are available per CPU core in the PC250’s AMD Zen 2 mobile processor?
questions.explanation: The Zen 2 mobile core on the PC250 has 6 physical cores and 12 threads, meaning each core supports 2 threads via simultaneous multithreading. The other options either underestimate (A, C) or overestimate (D) this count.

questions.question: What is the fixed memory split in the default BIOS of the standard PC250 before any modifications?
questions.explanation: The original BIOS offers splits of 8/10 GB or 6/10 GB, the most common configuration being 8 GB to CPU and 10 GB to GPU. Option A matches this default; the other options list splits that are either not present or are less typical.

questions.question: Why is a Linux operating system required for full functionality of the BC250 nodes?

options.A: Windows drivers for the custom Zen 2 core are proprietary and unstable.
options.B: Linux provides native support for NVMe drives that Windows lacks.
options.C: Only community‑built, open‑source drivers for the mixed Vega/RDNA components are available under Linux.
options.D: The BIOS firmware is delivered as a Linux binary that cannot be executed on Windows.

questions.explanation: All driver support for the hybrid GPU architecture is open‑source and maintained within the Linux ecosystem; no Windows drivers exist. Option A misstates the issue; B refers to storage, not drivers; D incorrectly claims a Linux‑only binary. Thus C is correct.

questions.question: What is the permissible range for the dynamic memory split you can set after flashing the modified BIOS?
questions.explanation: Dynamic memory can be configured from 1 GB up to 12 GB, allowing administrators to allocate between CPU and GPU within this bounds. The other ranges either include values outside the allowed limits or do not align with the 16 GB total pool.

questions.question: How many BC250 nodes are assembled into one full PC250 chassis?
questions.explanation: The PC250 unit, often called the Azraq rack, houses precisely 12 BC250 nodes. The number 12 is repeated in the hardware overview and throughout the documentation; the other numbers are not used.

questions.question: Which factor was primarily responsible for the drastic drop in node price after the mining boom subsided?

options.B: The shift to RDNA‑2 GPUs made the hardware superseded
options.C: GPU mining became obsolete, reducing demand for the hardware
options.D: A large volume of surplus firmware updates were released

questions.explanation: Once GPU‑mining profitability fell, there was a surplus of unused hardware. This excess supply drove the node price down significantly—an effect explicitly mentioned in the price evolution section. The other options are unrelated to the cost decline.

questions.question: Compared to the original PS5 version, the PC250’s CPU has fewer cores. What is the exact core count difference?

options.C: Both have the same number of cores

questions.explanation: The PC250’s AMD‑Zen 2 mobile processor has 6 cores, whereas the PS5 version employed 8 cores. Thus the PC250 has 2 fewer cores, making option B correct. Options A, C, and D misrepresent the difference.

questions.question: Which step is essential when flashing the modified BIOS onto the BC250 through the EFI shell?

options.A: Back up the original BIOS with the command UEFI> backup BIOS#1
options.B: Install a third‑party Windows driver before flashing
options.C: Reboot directly into the new BIOS without resetting the CMOS
options.D: Disable all power‑saving modes in the BIOS first

questions.explanation: The flashing procedure explicitly instructs to back up the original BIOS first. The other steps are not part of or are contrary to the documented flashing flow.

questions.question: What advantage does configuring the dynamic memory split to 512 MB for the CPU provide?

options.A: It allows the server to boot faster in headless mode
options.B: It maximizes GPU memory allocation for high‑resolution gaming
options.C: It enables the CPU to access the full 16 GB of GDDR6 memory
options.D: It reduces power consumption by limiting CPU memory usage

questions.explanation: Setting a minimal CPU memory split (512 MB) frees the majority of the shared 16 GB pool for GPU use, which is particularly beneficial for high‑resolution or graphical workloads in cloud gaming. Option C incorrectly suggests CPU access to all memory; D misstates power effects; A is irrelevant.
